page.title: 18TRADE IN CHATBURN AREA 85
page.content: Trade in the area for 1985 has been fairly bouyant despite the terrible weather in the summer and its consequ- ent effect on tourism and consumer expenditure.All the villages benefit from a varied range of retail outlets ranging from Pension Collection to Pins.Most remain competitive despite Super and Hyper Market pressure.There are no empty shops.Chatburn is the busiest village retail wise with its 3 pubs,Post Office,Butchers,Bakery, 2 General Shops,Fish and Chips,and Funeral Parlour.W.Bradford has a Post Office,Pub and General Store.Grin'ton has 2 pubs,Post Office and General Store.Within the area the trade has developed through the change of use of spacious country residences to Kennels \Catteries,Riding Stables,Residen.Homes Homes for Retired Gentlefolk,a caravan Park,Catering etc.
